Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2012 05:29AM sunrays123 wrote: First off, let me say that this site is amazing.  Full of wonderful people !   Duckie, I'm happy to hear theat the PET was negative.  We still haven't gotten the results back.  Biopsy was done on Friday.  She didnt tell any of us about the 2 cm lump and went all on her own.  She didnt want to scare us.  The Dr. said it was most likely malignant but wanted to biopsy it.  She has an MRI scheduled for tomorrow morning.  There is a part of me that is holding on to some hope in that the doctor is wrong.  And that is something else.  Is that worng?  I dont know what or how to think.  I have sat in the house for 3 days researching and thinking and I am just beside myself.  I call her my Mom - but she is really my aunt who raised my sister and I after my Mom died at 34 of an odd form of lung cancer. She is the rock of our family !  I am just nauseous typing this note.  I would love to continue to talk to people who might be supportive and that understand.  I am not prepared for this.  She is 58 and too young to have to face this.  And she is a wonderful person.  I am rambling - but I am scared for her and for all of us.  If anyone can offer some encouragement, I would very much appreciate it.   Duckie -  keep me posted and I will keep my best thoughts for your Mom and your family.

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 12:00PM sunrays123 wrote: My Mom was biopsied on Friday and we are waiting to hear results.  She found a 2 cm lump in the top of herr left breast a couple of months back.  However she has had many lypomas throughout her life and thought it was probably another one.So until a couple of weeks back as her friend started chemo for breast C - she decided she better have it looked at.   Recently she has gone through menopause and went on a life changing diet and lost lots of weight.  She looks great and has never been healthier. I am also very scared and nervous as we wait for results.  However, she was told by the radiologist that it is likely cancer. I can only hope and pray that they are wrong.
